definition: to become hot/temperature rise/(fig.) to intensify/to hot up/to escalate/to get a boost
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]

pinyin: quan2 qiu2 qi4 hou4 sheng1 wen1

sentences.english: In the past few years, however, there has been an upsurge of research into the female sexual response.
sentences.chinese: 但在过去的几年里，对女性性反应的研究骤然升温。

sentences.english: This can be seen in this wine ewer and warming basin.

sentences.chinese: 无法满足高光注塑中快速升温及快速降温的需要。

sentences.english: Late 2005, the nuclear standoff in North Korea is coming to a boil.
sentences.chinese: 直至2005，看似平和的核危机将于北韩再度升温。

sentences.english: Linear temperature control system in TSC measurement has been developed by using microprocessor.

sentences.english: The thermoluminescence peak moves to the high temperature when the heating speed increasing.
sentences.chinese: 在实验升温速率增大情况下，该峰值将向高温区移动。

sentences.english: Even mighty mountains are no match for a little rising thermometer.
sentences.chinese: 即使是强有力的高山也承受不了一点点升温。

sentences.english: The heating rate has an important effect on the, property of the YSZ porous ceramic tubes.
sentences.chinese: 升温速度对YSZ多孔陶瓷管的性能有著重要影响。

All the respondent could get a GWP after the research.

sentences.english: Furnace heating rapidly, temperature uniformity, no dust.
sentences.chinese: 炉内升温快，温度均匀，无烟尘。

sentences.english: At this great height, rocks, warmed by the sun, melt small snowdrifts.
sentences.chinese: 在这个高度，岩石被太阳照耀升温，融化成了小雪堆。

sentences.english: The products use dry ice and liquid nitrogen, stored large quantity of smoke capacity.
sentences.chinese: 平方米，烟雾储存量和热水容量大，升温快。

sentences.english: Speculations over Xiaomi manufacturing phones in India are once again heating up.
sentences.chinese: 小米手机印度产的猜测再次升温。

sentences.english: He said, "in this context, Sihong folk usurious warming."
sentences.chinese: 他说，在这个背景下，泗洪的民间高利贷升温。

definition: to become cooler/to lower the temperature/cooling/(of interest, activity etc) to decline
(of the weather) to warm up again
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
